title: Business Live: FTSE rally fizzles out - BBC News
summary: mps call for end to unpaid shift work .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for thursday on business live .
we 'll be back bright and early at 06:00 tomorrow .
do join us then for all the latest breaking news and analysis from the business world .

documents.title: glaxosmithkline estimates high brexit costs
text: drug maker glaxosmithkline has estimated that brexit will cost it as much as £ 70m over the next two to three years .
according to its annual report , glaxo also predicts that after brexit , it will have additional annual costs of £ 50m , including additional customs duties and transaction or administration costs .
the estimates are based only on the firm 's initial assumptions of how much brexit will cost , garnered from current available information .

`` delivering these necessary but complex changes by march 2019 will be ambitious and potentially disruptive in the short term and we support efforts to secure a status quo transition period to minimise disruption , '' said glaxo 's chief financial officer simon dingemans .
`` over the longer term , we continue to believe that brexit will not have a material impact on our business . ''

documents.title: dow closes slightly ahead
text: the dow jones industrial average has closed slightly higher , rising 115 points to 24,874 .
the s & p 500 fell 2 points to 2,747 .
the tech-heavy nasdaq was lower , slipping 15 points to 7,482 .

documents.title: white house to remain 'tough on russia '
text: the white house has said it intends to maintain tough policies against russia until moscow changes its behaviour .
on thursday , the us imposed more sanctions on russian individuals for allegedly meddling in the us election .
however , the government did not come down on oligarchs and officials close to putin , which prompted some criticism .

`` i think you can see from the actions we 've taken up until this point we 're going to be tough on russia until they decide to change their behaviour , '' white house spokeswoman sarah sanders told a regular briefing after being asked if russian president vladimir putin was `` playing '' trump .

documents.title: unilever leaving uk due to 'icy relations '
text: unilever is apparently moving its global headquarters from london to rotterdam in the netherlands due to alleged icy treatment from uk prime minister theresa may .

according to the ft , ms may refused to take calls from unilever 's chief executive paul polman - and many other firms - or to meet with him , when kraft heinz issued its hostile takeover bid after the brexit vote .
ms may was allegedly trying to distance herself from big business in order to make herself look closer to working families .
where the uk government was icy in unilever 's time of crisis , the dutch government was welcoming and willing to lower corporation tax , as well as scrapping a dividend tax .

documents.title: the french response to the skripal poisoning
text: world service presenter tim franks tweets about the french response to the skripal poisoning

the french express their displeasure over the poisoning - via @ twitterid `` the ( presidential ) source said macron would snub the official russian stand at the paris book fair later on thursday to show solidarity with britain . ''
wonder if there will be any boycotting of the lyon - cska moscow europa league match tonight ?
that 'll learn 'em
teach them .
not learn them .

documents.title: coutts star banker in sexual harassment claims
text: a star banker at coutts , the private bank used by the queen , is at the centre of a series of complaints about sexual harassment .
harry keogh was accused of lewd comments , heavy drinking and unwanted physical contact .
according to a wall street journal report , following an internal investigation , the chief executive recommended that he leave the bank .
although he received a final written warning , mr keogh is still at coutts .

documents.title: the us is blaming russia too
text: bbc 's business reporter joe miller tweets about the us treasury openly blaming russia for the skripal poisoning incident
key passage in us treasury 's statement on new russian sanctions .
points the finger unequivocally at russia for skripal poisoning .
( which @ twitterid has yet to do )
trouble is trump & bojo are proven liars & david dogy davis was a communist ?
so , the treasury is now a separate branch of government ?

documents.title: argos and smyths to gain the most from toys 'r ' us closure
text: it might surprise you , but amazon is n't the top winner from the close of toys 'r ' us in the uk , according to research firm globaldata retail
# toysrus stores are set to close within the next 6 weeks in the uk , after failed attempts to locate a buyer .
surprisingly @ twitterid will not be benefitting the most , @ twitterid says that instead - @ twitterid and @ twitterid will actually have the most to gain .

documents.title: cmc markets launches cryptocurrency trading
text: uk online trading platform cmc markets has announced that it has launched cryptocurrency trading .
cmc markets ' professional client base will be able to partake in contracts for differences ( cfds ) and spreadbetting .
these are financial products that give an investor exposure to price movements in securities without actually owning the underlying assets such as a currency , commodity or stock .
in the us , cme , the world 's largest futures exchange , launched bitcoin futures on wall street in december .

documents.title: trump 'admitted making up figures to justin trudeau '
text: us president donald trump admitted making up trade figures in a meeting with prime minister justin trudeau , according to the washington post .
at a private fundraiser , he reportedly said he insisted to mr trudeau the us had a trade deficit with canada , though he had `` no idea '' if it was true .
mr trump maintained in a tweet the us does have a trade deficit with canada .
but the us department of commerce says the us ran a $ 2.8bn ( £ 2bn ) trade surplus with canada in 2017 .
reality check : is trump right about us trade deficit ?

documents.title: espn 's president stepped down after being extorted
text: espn 's former president john skipper says he was forced to resign his position in december due to an extortion plot concocted by his cocaine dealer .
mr skipper told the hollywood reporter in an exclusive interview that he , his family and his professional life were put at risk .

he says he never used cocaine at work , and after discussing the issue with disney 's chief executive bob iger , he realised that he had put mr iger in `` an untenable position '' and as a result , he needed to resign .
`` i never cry personally .
that 's the only day that i cried .
and i cried because i realised the profundity of what i 'd done to myself , to my family , and that i 'd given up the best job in sports on the planet , '' he told the hollywood reporter .

documents.title: spotify says its path towards profits is clear
text: online music streaming service spotify has told investors that its path to profitability is clear , despite the fact it is still making a loss .
spotify 's revenue grew 39 % to €4.09bn in 2017 , from €2.95bn in the previous year .
however , at the same time its operating losses grew from €349m to €378m in 2017 .

`` operating losses have grown with revenue , but the trend towards profitability is clear when you look at operating losses as a percentage of revenue , '' the company said in an investor presentation .
on thursday , spotify is holding a public webcast to woo investors ahead of it listing on the new york stock exchange in early april .

documents.title: stephen hawking 's advice for a 'fulfilling career '
text: in a 2010 interview with american journalist diane sawyer on abc world news , sawyer asked renowned scientist stephen hawking what advice he 'd give to his children .
one of the pieces of advice he said was : work gives you meaning and purpose , and life is empty without it . ''
so what do career and leadership experts think ?

documents.title: breakingrihanna hits out at snapchat
text: rihanna has accused snapchat of `` intentionally '' shaming victims of domestic abuse .
the singer was the subject of an advert on the platform which asked users if they would `` rather slap rihanna or punch chris brown '' .
the ad , which was for a game , appeared to reference chris brown 's conviction for assaulting rihanna in 2009 while they were dating .
rihanna posted a lengthy comment on an instagram story saying she was `` trying to figure out what the point was with this mess '' .
`` i 'd love to call it ignorance , but i know you ai n't that dumb , '' she wrote .

documents.title: london closes slightly ahead
text: london shares have closed slightly ahead , thanks to gains in financials , healthcare and industrials , which off-set the losing streak of the last three days , as consumer goods giant unilever announced that it will give up its london headquarters and move its base to the netherlands .
the ftse 100 gained 7 points or 0.1 % to 7,139.76 , led by standard life aberdeen , rising 1.8 % to 372.6p following the news it is setting aside £ 35m to pay for investment research .
meanwhile the ftse 250 edged up 8.3 points or 0.04 % to 19,828.41 .

top of the winners was hikma pharmaceuticals , climbing 19 % to £ 11.05 , despite the fact it reported a loss due to its asthma inhaler alternative being rejected by the us food and drug administration ( fda ) until 2020 .

documents.title: apple responds to 'abusive business practices ' claim
text: apple has sent the bbc a response to french finance minister bruno le maire 's accusation that apple and google are engaging in `` abusive business practices '' that are detrimental to french start-ups .
`` we are proud to have strong relationships with tens of thousands of developers across france , who have earned €1bn on the app store , '' an apple spokesperson said .
`` many of these talented developers began their companies with one or two people and have grown into larger teams that offer their apps to users in up to 155 countries .
this was only possible due to the investment apple makes in ios , developer tools , and the app store .
`` apple has always stood for user privacy and security and does not have access to user transactions with third party apps .
we look forward to telling our story to the french courts and clearing up this misunderstanding .
`` in the meantime , we will continue to help french developers achieve their dreams and assist french students learning to code by offering our coding curriculum . ''

documents.title: apple and google in trouble in france
text: apple and google are embroiled in a row with the french government over how app developers are treated when they sell their apps to the two companies ' app stores .
france 's finance minister bruno le maire claims that google and apple have `` abusive business practices '' and are imposing unfair conditions on french start-ups .
he said that the two firms `` gather data '' about the start-ups and `` can unilaterally modify contracts '' .
`` i consider that google and apple , as powerful as they are , should n't treat our start-ups and our developers in the way they do today , '' mr le maire told rtl radio .

documents.title: payment fraud : millions lost in money transfer trick
text: victims of a fraud which leads them to transfer money to a con-artist are ty losing nearly £ 3,000 each , new figures show .
the cost of so-called authorised push payment fraud has been calculated by uk finance , the banking trade body .
a total of £ 236m was lost last year , with banks unable to return nearly three-quarters ( 74 % ) of the money lost .
victims think they are transferring money to someone official , such as a solicitor .

documents.title: where do women earn more than men in the us ?
text: a new analysis by stateline , a publication of the pew charitable trusts , found only seven communities across the country where women make significantly more than men .

documents.title: statoil gives birth to equinor
text: is there such a thing as taking oneself too seriously ?
take statoil , for example .
the norwegian company is changing its name to equinor to show that it is `` evolving from an oil and gas company to a broad energy company '' .
and it has a video to tell everyone all about why , beginning with the birth of a child , segueing into footage of a teenager squeezing his spots with a shot of a cartoon butterfly along the way .
it 's all about change , you see .
you can view this magnum opus at

documents.title: what business sanctions might the uk apply against russia ?
text: following the skripal poisoning , what kind of business sanctions might the uk government apply against russia ?
bbc radio 4 explains .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: lufthansa reports 'best profits in its history '
text: german airline giant lufthansa has reported record profits for 2017 - its net profits rose 33.1 % to it €2.36bn , beating analyst expectations .
total revenues for the lufthansa group in 2017 amounted to €35.6 billion , a 12.4 % increase on the previous year .
`` we have achieved the best result in the history of our company , '' said carsten spohr , chairman of the executive board and chief executive of lufthansa .
last year we were able to reduce costs again , while at the same time becoming the first - and the only - airline in europe to be awarded a five-star rating .
we are lowering our costs where this does not affect the customer , and are simultaneously further investing in our product and service quality . ''

documents.title: bad blood : the rise and fall of theranos and elizabeth holmes
text: thirteen years ago , elizabeth holmes , aged 19 , came up with an idea that she believed could change the world .
called `` edison '' , after the inventor , it promised to revolutionise blood testing .
theranos planned to charge less than half the rates charged by medicare and medicaid in the us - potentially saving the us government $ 200bn over the next decade .

this is what she said to a new yorker reporter when he asked how `` edison '' worked : `` a chemistry is performed so that a chemical reaction occurs and generates a signal from the chemical interaction with the sample , which is translated into a result , which is then reviewed by certified laboratory personnel . ''
there was just one problem : it did n't work .
however , that failed to stop her creating a billion dollar company , theranos , on the back of it .
on wednesday the illusion finally shattered as she lost control of the firm and was fined $ 500,000 .

documents.title: wall street opens higher
text: wall street has opened higher , led by gains in financial and energy stocks , due to support from strong economic data .

the dow jones is currently 111.4 points or 0.45 % ahead to 24,869.50 , led by ibm , up 1.2 % to $ 159.97 on the news it is teaming up with mastercard to build the eu 's first ever independent `` data trust '' .
the s & p 500 is slightly ahead , rising 4 points or 0.14 % to 2,753.46 .
dollar general corp tops the winners , due to the discount retailer reporting fourth-quarter same-store sales that beat analyst expectations and a positive earnings outlook .
however , the tech-heavy nasdaq has seen a dip , dropping 4.1 points or 0.05 % to 7,492.70 .

the top loser on the index is technology development firm spherix inc , falling 24.4 % to $ 1.29 after announcing that it priced a registered public offering of common stock at $ 1.35 , in order to raise $ 3m .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks ben and dearbail for this morning 's live coverage of all things business .
mary-ann russon with you until 21:30 for the rest of the day 's news and views .
got a point of view ?

documents.title: uk holds 'constructive ' talks with us on trade
text: international trade secretary liam fox ( says that he had a `` constructive '' meeting with us trade representative robert lighthizer on wednesday where they discussed president trump 's plan to impose tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to north america .
he said : `` ambassador lighthizer and i enjoyed a constructive meeting that touched on our shared ambition for a far deeper trade relationship both now and once the uk has left the eu .
we also spoke about the united states ' planned imposition of tariffs on steel and aluminum . ''
mr lighthizer said : secretary of state fox and i had very productive discussions on how to deepen our already extensive trade relationship - both now and when the uk leaves the eu . ''

text: davis 'can live with ' shorter transition

documents.title: mixed open for us stocks
text: the dow jones industrial average has opened up 7.46 points at 24,765.58 .
conversely , the s & p 500 is down 15.83 points at 2,749.48 and the nasdaq is off 5.31 points at 7,491.50 .

documents.title: elliott seeks to remove telecom italia chairman
text: activist investor elliott international is requesting that telecom italia remove its chairman and five other members of its board .
arnaud de puyfontaine ( is executive chairman of telecom italia and also the chief executive of the company 's largest shareholder vivendi .

elliott has built up a stake in telecom italia and said last week that the governance , valuation , strategic direction and relationships with italian authorities would be improved by replacing certain members of the board '' .
elliott along with liverpool limited partnership have requested that a motion to remove the members is included in the agenda for the upcoming shareholder meeting .

documents.title: the joy of failure
text: fail harder

documents.title: hsbc discloses gender pay gap
text: hsbc has reported a 29 % median gender pay gap for its main uk banking operations .
however , the bank also disclosed a 60 % gap on the mean measure for hourly pay .
the bbc 's head of statistics robert cuffe explains the difference between the mean and median and why it matters :
`` if you rank all employees from lowest to highest paid , the median is the salary in the middle .
the mean is how much pay there is to go around : the total wage bill divided by the number of employees .
`` the mean can be moved a lot by a small number of big earners .
if you hire ronaldo or jennifer lawrence , the wage bill will shoot upwards and so will the mean salary .
the median will be unchanged .
`` that 's what 's causing the difference at hsbc . ''
read the full story here .

documents.title: ftse 100 gives up gains
text: the ftse 100 has given up early ( modest ) gains and is back to where it started .
losses for micro focus international , gkn and just eat are weighing on the market .

`` not only are investors concerned about an international trade war , in terms of more uk-specific issues a 25 % post-profit warning plunge from consumer goods firm pz cussons sparked losses for its ftse 100 cousins reckitt benckiser and unilever , '' said connor campbell , financial analyst at spreadex .
however , supermarket giant tesco is trading 3 % higher after some positive comments from analysts at jp morgan cazenove , who say the deal to buy booker will be `` transformational '' .

documents.title: bumper growth for ireland
text: the irish economy roared ahead last year , with growth of 7.8 % , according to the central statistics office .
that makes is the fastest growing economy in the european union for the fourth year in a row .
however , economists are ireland 's growth figures are distorted by the presence of many multinational firms in ireland , who have been attracted by its tax laws .
the nation 's statistics office is phasing in measures that allow for those activities .
but there is agreement that ireland has rebounded from the economic crisis ten years ago .

documents.title: audi model bonanza this year
text: audi intends plans to introduce a new model every three weeks this year .
that includes a new version of the a6 and a brand new model , the q8 (
the car maker , owned by volkswagen , saw sales decline last year .
it expects the new models to start improving its financial performance in 2019 .

`` 1 in 3 britons consider being intimate with a robot '' - more top quality research from the pr industry in my inbox

documents.title: why is unilever moving hq from london ?
text: both unilever 's boss and the uk government were absolutely adamant that the company 's decision to scrap its uk headquarters has got nothing to do with brexit .
the real reason unilever is leaving is takeovers .
defending against them and potentially making them .

when kraft heinz launched one of the world 's biggest , and shortest lived , takeover bids for unilever last year , paul polman could be found complaining that uk takeover rules pandered to the interests of shareholders over other interests - like customers , workers , suppliers , communities and the environment .
in the netherlands , those wider interests hold much more legal and cultural sway and so it 's harder for a corporate raider to succeed .
you can read more from simon here .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: tesco shares boosted by analyst comments
text: tesco shares are among the top winners on the ftse 100 today , with a 2.4 % gain .
probably helping shares is a postive report on tesco from analysts at jp morgan cazenove .
the report says tesco will be transformed by the deal to buy wholesaler booker .
the uk wholesale market , worth £ 30bn a year , will be opened up to tesco , the report points out .

you can find out more about him here .

documents.title: ftse 100 holds onto gains
text: the ftse 100 is holding onto its meager gains and is up 0.14 % at 7,142.97 .
pharmaceutical group shire leads the risers , up 2.7 % at £ 32.30 .
property group hammerson is the largest faller , with its share price down 5.37 % at 432.1p .
shares in pz cussons are still down but have clawed back some ground to trade 15.4 % lower at 234p following a profit warning .
the ftse 250 is down 0.35 % at 19,749.92 .

documents.title: annual loss for virgin atlantic
text: they say owning an airline is a great way to lose money and it seems virgin atlantic has proved that true .
a weaker pound , engine supply problems and hurricanes disrupting operations in the us and the caribbean helped push the airline to an annual loss for 2017 .
virgin , now partly owned by delta , posted a pre-tax loss of £ 28.4m compared to a £ 23m profit for 2016 .
revenue dipped 1 % to £ 2.7bn as virgin flew 100,000 fewer customers at 5.3 million .
the load factor slipped slightly to 78.3 %
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: pierce brosnan 'cheated ' by india mouth freshener brand
text: pierce brosnan says india mouth freshener brand 'cheated ' him

documents.title: gkn 's us deal 'is flawed ' says melrose
text: christopher miller , the chairman of melrose , says the company would `` be delighted to explain to all customers and stakeholders '' why its plan to invest in gkn `` is the right way forward '' for the company .

referring to gkn 's deal to sell its us automotive unit to dana for $ 6bn , mr miller said : `` we are certain that gkn 's new strategy of hasty short term business break up will not benefit the long term requirements of customers .
`` in the aerospace segment we note that gkn has received approaches for that division , while at the same time contemplating a flawed sale of its auto division to a us buyer .
`` as a result , the aerospace unit will be disproportionately burdened with gross pension liabilities , restricting potential investment and innovation . ''

documents.title: melrose 'is not an appropriate owner of gkn '
text: gkn 's chairman mike turner backs the comments from airbus , a major aerospace customer , regarding the hostile takeover bid by melrose .

he says : the comments from airbus that stress the need for long-term investment and strategic vision in our industry emphasise our firmly held belief that melrose is not an appropriate owner of gkn .
its management lacks the relevant experience and its short-term business model is inappropriate for gkn 's customers and investors . ''

he adds : `` as we have previously stated , and as these comments from airbus reinforce , winning new business in our markets would be more difficult if customers were uncertain as to the identity of their future long-term partners . ''

documents.title: airbus : industry requires long-term commitment
text: commenting on melrose 's proposed takeover of gkn , airbus said : `` airbus fully supports industry development and consolidation through m & a activities .
`` however , the nature of our industry is one that requires a commitment to long-term investment and strategic vision .
the industry does not lend itself to shorter term financial investment which naturally reduces r & d budgets and limits vital innovation .
`` it would be practically impossible for us to give any new work to gkn under such ownership model when we do n't know who will be the long term investor . ''

documents.title: airbus warns over gkn takeover bid
text: airbus has warned that it could not give any new business to uk engineering giant gkn if it were taken over by turnaround specialist melrose .
gkn makes wing components and other key aircraft parts for airbus , which is its biggest customer .
however , it is currently fighting off a hostile bid from melrose , saying it fundamentally undervalues the firm .
airbus 's tom williams said a change like that would make it `` practically impossible '' to keep working with gkn .

documents.title: call to reopen barroso ethics case
text: the european commission has called for reopening the ethics case against its former chief jose manuel barroso , who was previously cleared of breaking bloc rules by taking a top job with goldman sachs .
the ec should `` refer the case of the former commission president back for an opinion by the ethics committee '' , ombudsman emily o'reilly said in a statement .

documents.title: government reassures on gas supplies
text: just in case there are any concerns that strained relations with russia will have an impact on gas supplies to the uk , the government says there is nothing to fear - especially with forecasts of snow at the weekend to look forward to .
`` great britain benefits from highly diverse and flexible sources of gas supply , '' says a spokesperson for the department for business , energy and industrial strategy .
`` we estimate less than one per cent of our gas comes from russia and are in no way reliant on it . ''

documents.title: court rules mafia not suitable in restaurant name
text: a spanish restaurant has been stopped from using the word mafia in its name , following an eu court ruling .
la honorable hermandad wanted to register the trademark la mafia se sienta a la mesa '' or the mafia sits at the table '' .
however , italy objected , saying it conveyed `` a message of conviviality and trivialised the word element 'la mafia ' , thereby distorting the serious connotations of that word '' .

the general court of the european union agreed , saying that the word is understood worldwide to an organisation that resorts `` to intimidation , physical violence and murder in carrying out its activities '' and is likely to `` shock or offend '' .

documents.title: have your say : the benefit of scrapping the 1p and 2p
text: the government appears to be backing down from the idea of scrapping 1p and 2p coins after publishing a consultation into `` cash and digital payments in the new economy '' .
a spokesperson for theresa may said that there are `` no proposals to scrap 1p or 2p coins in the consultation '' .
however , should the government get rid of copper coins ?
is there a benefit to binning them ?
the bbc would like to hear from you .
email us bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk
in the rmean time , here 's a handy guide on what do to with copper coins - including using them to perk up your tulips .

documents.title: chief of investment bank at soc gen quits
text: there 's been a significant departure at french banking giant , societe generale .
didier valet , who is in charge of investment banking activities , is leaving the bank .
in its public statement , the company is somewhat vague about why he is going .

`` following a divergence of approaches regarding the management of a specific legal matter , which predates his appointment as deputy ceo , didier valet resigned in order to preserve the bank 's general interests , '' soc gen said in a statement .
it is being reported that the `` divergence of approaches '' relates to how the bank handles investigations into the rigging of the libor interest rate .
in august , us authorities charged two former managers at soc gen with taking part in a scheme to manipulate the us dollar libor benchmark .

documents.title: savills sees 'tempering ' in some parts of housing market
text: estate agency savills has reported a 13 % rise in full-year pre-tax profit to £ 112.4m .
sales were up 11 % at £ 1.6bn .

chief executive jeremy helsby say the company has made a `` solid start '' to 2018 `` with a pipeline of business carried over from last year in many markets , although this is against the backdrop of heightened market uncertainty , geopolitical risks and rising interest rates '' .

however , he said : `` we anticipate a tempering of the strong transaction volumes of recent times in some markets ; however , at this early stage in the year our expectations for 2018 remain unchanged . ''

documents.title: where now for unilever 's listing ?
text: unilever is the third largest company listed on the ftse 100 .
will relocating the marmite-maker 's headquarters to rotterdam mean that it will leave the london blue chip index ?
possibly not .
it is understood that unilever is in talks with the london stock exchange about remaining in the ftse 100 .
no decision taken has been taken yet .

documents.title: ftse 100 moves higher in early trading
text: the ftse 100 has started the day with a modest gain , it 's trading 0.16 % higher at 7,146 .
among the movers in london today :
cineworld is up 2.4 % after strong annual profits .
savilles had edged 0.3 % lower after its results .

documents.title: breakingpz cussons shares tumble 25 %
text: shares in pz cussons have tumbled more than 25 % after a profit warning ( see earlier post ) .

documents.title: persimmon names new chairman
text: persimmon has appointed roger devlin as its new chairman to replace nicholas wrigley who left following controversy over the house-builder 's executive bonus scheme .
mr devlin will join the company on 1 june .
he is also chairman designate of the bookmaker william hill , chairman of pub operator marston 's and senior independent director of the football association .
he will step down from marston 's and the fa .
mr devlin says he `` looks forward to working with jeff fairburn , his executive team and the board '' .
chief executive mr fairburn recently agreed to give up part of a share-based bonus worth nearly £ 100m .

documents.title: cineworld upbeat for 2018
text: cineworld has reported a 23 % jump in annual pre-tax profits £ 120.5m .
last year it announced the purchase of us based regal entertainment .
that addition brings its total number of cinemas to more than 800 in ten countries .

cineworld says there has been a `` pleasing '' start to the year and says 2018 has a strong line-up of movies including jurassic world : fallen kingdom , avengers : infinity war and solo : a star wars story .

documents.title: german business seeks one year transition
text: brexit secretary david davis has said he is prepared to `` live with '' the european union 's offer of a shorter transition period after the uk leaves the bloc next march .
the federation of german industries is demanding that the uk agree to an interim period by next week .
its director general joachim lang tells the today programme that german companies in the uk have been putting contingency plans in place .
`` our companies have carefully analysed their value chain in the uk , '' he says .
`` many of them have realised that they need at least one year before the real brexit to prepare and this is what all these contingencies plans are about . ''
which means ?

`` very often it is about licences and regulation which means if the uk is no longer part of the european union a lot of the business processes do n't work anymore because they do n't have access to the european market . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: pz cussons : the turnaround plan
text: so what is pz cussons going to do to reinvigorate the business ?
well the company has these plans :

documents.title: brexit is not behind the move , says unilever boss
text: unilever 's chief executive paul polman says the decision to move its headquarters to rotterdam is not about brexit .
`` the opposite is true , '' he says .
`` we would not be investing in our two headquarters here for the two divisions in the uk .
we would not have secured the £ 1bn spending if that were the case .
`` both countries are very attractive from an investment point of view .
we have a long history here that we are proud of and we 're happy that we can continue to build on that . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: unilever to maintain big uk presence
text: unilever 's chief executive paul polman says the company is moving its headquarters to rotterdam because it will make it simpler , more focused and `` more agile '' .
`` the idea here obviously is to build long-term value , '' he says .
he explains that unilever 's business is restructuring and will have three divisions , two of which will be in the uk .
`` one is the beauty and personal care division and the other one is the home care division .
that 's about 60 % of our business and secures about £ 1bn spending a year including r+d .
`` in fact we 're just opening a very advanced manufacturing centre on the wirral with about a £ 60m investment , '' he said .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: pz cussons warns on profits
text: pz cussons has warned that its full-year pre-tax profits `` will fall short of expectations '' .
it expects pre-tax profits of between £ 80m and £ 85m .
in the uk it said consumer caution was slowing sales - it blamed economic uncertainty and weak wage growth .
in nigeria - another important market - it said consumers were subdued and competition was `` intense '' .
the company is reviewing its business and promises to strengthen its performance .

documents.title: asian markets : japan up ; shanghai down
text: asian markets were mixed on thursday .
the benchmark nikkei 225 ended the day in positive territory , up by 0.1 % to 21,803 points .
south korea 's benchmark kospi index also ended the day up , gaining 0.25 % to 2,492 points .
in australia , however , the s & p/asx 200 index ended the session down 0.24 % to 5,920 points , dragged down by the country 's biggest lenders .
the australian government is leading an inquiry into the country 's banking sector and fraudulent lending practices .
by late afternoon trade in china , hong kong 's hang seng index was up by 0.3 % while the shanghai composite was down 0.18 % .

documents.title: unilever likely to leave ftse 100bbc today business presenter dominic o'connell tweets
text: @ unilever confirms ending of dual-national structure , will move to main listing in holland .
probably out of ftse 100 @ twitterid
particularly love your attempts to prove this has nothing to do with brexit - timing is massive coincidence .
more pathetic pro-brexit canvassing from the beeb
what does this mean for shareholders of the uk share ?
is this correct and is german business ( bdi ) suggesting some kind of customs union -oat brexit .
did jeremy corbyn not ask for this a fortnight ago and was ridiculed by tories .

documents.title: unilever is committed to the uk , says government
text: commenting on unilever 's decision to move its headquarters to rotterdam , a government spokesperson said : `` unilever has today shown its long-term commitment to the uk by choosing to locate its two fastest-growing global business divisions in this country , safeguarding 7,300 jobs and £ 1bn a year of investment .

`` as the company itself has made clear , its decision to transfer a small number of jobs to a corporate hq in the netherlands is part of a long-term restructuring of the company and is not connected to the uk 's departure from the eu . ''

documents.title: breakingunilever confirms hq to shift out of london
text: unilever has confirmed that rotterdam will be its corporate base .
for almost a century it has operated headquarters in london ( see above ) and the netherlands .
the company said unilever 's employment of 7,300 people in the uk and 3,100 people in the netherlands will be unaffected by the changes announced today .

documents.title: russia : may 's balancing act
text: russia is big business for the city of london .
philip worman , managing director of consultancy gpw , tells the today programme : `` it 's massive .
so every law firm in the city now has a russian vip desk which is effectively a concierge which deals with tax , divorce , wealth management , everything . ''
but it goes the other way too - bp controls a 20 % stake in russia 's state-owned energy giant rosneft .
`` i think a third of bp 's oil production now comes from russia and that 's in our pensions , '' he says .
`` may has to think about that in how she imposes sanctions on russia . ''
he adds : `` it 's a very fine line to tread .
she does n't want to spook the city , particularly as we 're going into a period of uncertainty around brexit . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: russia : businesses are 'self-sanctioning '
text: there was much focus on the government 's decision on wednesday to expel 23 russian diplomats in response to the salisbury poisonings .
but philip worman , managing director of consultancy gpw , says one phrase uttered by theresa may stood out for him .
`` and that was the uk has the right to freeze russian state assets and that has a very chilling effect on the city .
he says : `` within hours of that statement coming out , we were being called by clients asking 'we 're structuring a deal with a russian state-owned entity - how exposed are we ' ? ''
`` we call it self-sanctioning so companies or the risk committees in uk companies are saying 'there are safer places to invest .
we do n't even want to risk engaging with an entity that might become sanctioned ' . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: amazon japan raided by fair trade regulator
text: amazon 's japan operation said that it had been raided by the country 's trade regulator on sus of a possible anti-trust violation .
a spokesman for the online retailer said it was fully co-operating with the fair trade commission .
the kyodo news agency reported that amazon is suspected of asking suppliers to pay a `` collaboration fee '' to sell their products at a discount on amazon japan .

documents.title: us senate approves relaxing of bank rules
text: the us senate has passed a bill to roll back banking regulations put in place in the wake of the 2008 global financial crisis .
the draft bill , which exempts banks with less than $ 250bn in assets from strict oversight under the dodd-frank act of 2010 , was approved in a 67-31 vote .
it must now go through the house of representatives where conservative republicans are expected to push for even further easing of regulations on small lenders .
the us chamber of commerce cheered the senate 's vote and said it proved that republicans and democrats could come together to help small businesses .

but the bill has divided democrats , with senator elizabeth warren , a democrat from massachusetts , warning it put `` american families in danger of getting punched in the gut in another financial crisis '' .
the dodd-frank act was brought in with the aim of avoiding another financial meltdown .

documents.title: unilever to move hq out of london - report
text: the times reports that unilever will move its headquarters to rotterdam .
since 1930 the company has operated two boards and two listings , one in london and one in the netherlands .
but a takeover approach from kraft heinz last year has spurred the company to simplify its structure .
the company is unlikely to blame brexit for the move , the times reports .
unilever is the third biggest firm listed on the london stock market , but would probably drop out of the ftse 100 if it moves its base .

documents.title: are firms allowed to use unpaid trial shifts ?
text: is it legal for employers to use unpaid `` trial '' shifts ?
for lois madden , an employment solicitor at thompsons in edinburgh the answer is no .
`` the law is clear , '' she says .
`` if someone asks you to come along and do some work for them for a few hours , then you are entitled to be paid at least the minimum wage , '' she said .
`` there 's a lot of misconception going around about this , a lot of employers do n't understand what they are allowed to do .
`` if it 's a genuine trial then you should n't expect any real work from this person , '' she said .
some mps and lawyers have called for a blanket ban on unpaid shift work .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: airbus questions melrose bid for gkn
text: the financial times reports that airbus would find it `` practically impossible '' to give new work to gkn if it is taken over by melrose industries .
`` the industry does not lend itself to shorter-term financial investment , '' tom williams , chief operating officer of commercial jets at airbus , told the financial times .
melrose denies accusations that it is a short-term investor , saying it acts as if it were owning the business for ever .
earlier this week gkn rejected an imporved offer from melrose .

documents.title: openreach to hires thousands of trainees
text: bt openreach , the provider of broadband infrastrucure in the uk , plans to recruit 3,500 trainee engineers to help install its high-speed broadband service .
some of those engineers will also help provide a better service , says kim mears , managing director for infrastructure delivery .
she says services are already improving .
`` if i look at missed appointments [ by engineers ] , that has been taken down significantly over the last year , '' she says .
the number of missed appointments is `` tiny '' says ms mears .
the new high-speed network will be even more reliable she says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to thursday 's business live page .
will unilever , the consumer products giant , move its headquarters out of london ?
we could find out later today .
bt openreach is hiring thousands of trainees that it says will work on faster broadband and will help improve customer services .
according to the ft , airbus is not happy about the prospect of melrose taking over gkn .
and the union unite says the number of complaints over unpaid work are now six times higher than three years ago .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
